intro: Dichapetalum spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in secondary forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
